step1.sentence: She had to overcome fear of public speaking before giving her first presentation at work.

step2.story: Mia had avoided swimming ever since she nearly drowned as a child. One summer, she signed up for adult swim lessons, determined to overcome fear that had controlled her for years. By the end of the course, she was swimming laps with a smile on her face.

step3.story: Jake stared at the climbing wall, his palms sweating and his heart pounding. Heights had terrified him ever since he fell from a tree as a boy. His therapist had suggested this exercise as a way to overcome fear gradually, one step at a time. He clipped into the harness, took a deep breath, and reached for the first hold. Halfway up, he paused and looked down — the ground seemed impossibly far away, but he kept going. When he finally touched the top, he let out a shaky laugh, realizing the fear no longer owned him.

meaning.realUsageKo: 무언가가 무섭거나 불안하지만 용기를 내어 그것을 해내거나 두려움 자체를 떨쳐낼 때 사용합니다. 구체적인 공포(고소공포증, 발표 공포 등)부터 막연한 불안감까지 폭넓게 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: overcome은 고대 영어 ofercuman(정복하다, 이기다)에서 유래했으며, fear는 고대 영어 fǣr(위험, 갑작스러운 재난)에서 왔습니다. 두 단어가 결합하여 '두려움을 정복하다'라는 의미로 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: overcome은 단순히 '참는다'가 아니라 적극적으로 맞서서 '이겨낸다'는 뉘앙스를 담고 있어, 노력과 용기가 수반되는 느낌을 줍니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He finally overcame his fear of flying and booked a trip abroad.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 마침내 비행 공포증을 극복하고 해외여행을 예약했다.
